## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
``` {r bigrams, eval = TRUE}
combi_bi <-  read.csv(file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/bi_bigrams.csv", colClasses = c("NULL", NA, NA,NA) )
combi_bi <- data.table(combi_bi)
print(prettyNum(object.size(combi_bi), big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE))
combi_bi <- setorder(setDT(combi_bi), word1, -n) [,indx :=seq_len(.N), by = word1] [indx <= 5 & n > 2]
write.csv(combi_bi, file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/shrink_bi.csv")
rm(combi_bi)
sen_combi_bi <-  read.csv(file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/sen_bi_bigrams.csv", colClasses = c("NULL", NA, NA,NA) )
sen_combi_bi <- data.table(sen_combi_bi)
print(prettyNum(object.size(sen_combi_bi), big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE))
sen_combi_bi <- setorder(setDT(sen_combi_bi), word1, -n) [,indx :=seq_len(.N), by = word1] [indx <= 5 & n > 2]
write.csv(sen_combi_bi, file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/shrink_sen_bi.csv")
rm(sen_combi_bi)
```
